children: Initial evaluation of a thyroid nodule. Size thresholds for FNAB are based on US appearance. A less suspicious lesion may not need FNAB until it is larger than 2 cm. A more suspicious nodule might be evaluated if it is larger than 1 cm. FNAB = fine-needle aspiration biopsy; T
= free thyroxine; TSH = thyroid-stimulating hormone; US = ultrasound.

footnotes: Need for US-guided FNAB depends on clinical risk factors for thyroid cancer, nodule size, and US appearance. See Table 30 for additional information.
